title: Waiting and Expectation
objective: Explain intertestamental hope for covenant fulfillment

segments.audio_script: This is lesson twenty-four. You are studying waiting and expectation. This is the final lesson in Biblical Foundations One.
Malachi is the final Old Testament book. It expresses covenant people's waiting. Messianic expectation is central. God promises future covenant messenger. New covenant fulfillment is anticipated.

Malachi promises covenant messenger to prepare the way. The text looks forward to dramatic covenant renewal. Intertestamental period is time of waiting. New covenant promises require ultimate fulfillment.
Key themes: messianic expectation is central to covenant theology. Covenant people wait for ultimate fulfillment. God's promises persist. New covenant is anticipated as future event.
What does Malachi promise will happen?
segments.correct_answer: A messenger will prepare the way for the Lord

segments.audio_script: This completes lesson twenty-four and Biblical Foundations One. You have studied covenant structure throughout Scripture. From creation through new covenant promise, covenant is God's framework for relationship. Congratulations on completing this course.

vocabulary.definition: Hope for future messenger or king who will fulfill God's covenant promises and restore covenant relationship
Historical era between Old and New Testament marked by waiting for covenant fulfillment

study_notes: Malachi's final words leave the covenant people waiting. The connection between Old and New Testament is this expectation. Jesus is presented as the fulfillment of these covenant hopes.
